WebHelpers

WebHelpers contains a wide variety of functions for web application templates, MVC controller code, and non-web applications. Main features:

  • Works with any web framework
  • An HTML tag generator that smartly escapes text content to prevent cross-site scripting attacks and double-escaping
  • Convenience functions to produce form tags, links, and other common tags.
  • A ModelTags object
It consists of several independent subpackages for generating HTML tags and form tags, text processing, displaying records a pageful at a time, generating Atom and RSS feeds, number formatting and statistical calculations, handling MIME types, and more. There are also high-level container types, including a value counter and accumulator. There are lists of country names, country codes, US states, Canadian provinces, and UK counties.:

constantsCountries & states for address forms
containersHigh-level containers & counters
dateDate/time helpers
feedgeneratorCreate Ato and RSS feeds
htmlGenerate HTML tags and form tags
markdown/textileConvert wiki-like text to HTML
mediaImage file calculations
mimehelperMIME types
numberFormatters and statistics
paginateDisplay records a pageful at a time
pylonslibHelpers for Pylons
textText processing

WebHelpers is pure Python and has no dependencies. However, a few helpers depend on Routes, , unidecode, WebOb as noted in their documentation. The Pylons helpers are designed for Pylons' request/response/session objects but can easily be ported to another web framework. WebHelpers comes with an extensive set of unit tests.

For support/question/patches, please use the ` Pylons mailing list.

New features

Version 1.0b1 (YYYY-MM-DD -- not released yet)

  • Documentation rewrite.
  • Many new helpers in html.converters, html.tags, html.tools, paginate, pylonslib, text.
  • Delete deprecated subpackages: commands, hinclude, htmlgen, pagination, rails. CAUTION: if using these helpers, stick to WebHelpers 0.6.4.

Version 0.6.4 (2008-12-02)

  • Several form helpers have magic ID attribute.
  • Bugfixes in ModelTags.select.
